intro: Satureja nervosa, commonly known as narrow-leaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are often used in cooking for their pungent, slightly peppery flavor. Satureja nervosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens and herbal collections.
